result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Statement of Negotiated Plea

Victim notification complied with.  Defendant plead no contest to Count 1 in 17CF104.  In 17CF231 defendant plead no contest to Counts 1 and 2.  In 17CM88 defendant plead no contest to Counts 1 and 2.  Remaining counts in those cases, plus 18CF43, 16CM79 and 17CM33, dismissed but read in for sentencing purposes.
Assistant District Attorney, Emily Hynek appeared on behalf of the State.  Attorney Kasey Grams apepars without her client.  Plea/sentencing will be scheduled.

Until further order of the court, you shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, except through your attorney, with any of the following individuals and/or businesses: E.L.    Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.  Not to associate with any known illegal drug users or dealers.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 17, 2018 at 11:00 am.
The defendant appeared by video from the Jackson County Jail.

Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.  Not to associate with any known illegal drug users or dealers.

Special Prosecutor, Emily Hyneck appeared on behalf of the State.    The defendant appeared by video from the Jackson County Jail.  No counsel present.  Defendant said he was at a funeral.  Cash bonds reinstated.  $300.00 cash bond covers cases with signature bonds.  Plea/sentencing to be rescheduled.

ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Defendant failed to appear for the plea/sentencing hearing.  Attorney Grams appeared in court.  Warrant authorized.
Plea/sentencing hearing on February 16, 2018 at 11:00 am.

Attorney Tom Bilski appears specially for Kasey Grams.  Defendant is in custody.  Special Prosecutor, William Nemer appeared on behalf of the State.  Attorney Bilski states they may have an agreement will be schedule for plea/sentencing on all cases.  Also requests bond be changed to a signature bond rather than cash.  

17CF231 - there is a victim.  State has not heard from victim at this point.  The State objects to amending the cash bond to a signature bond.  It was a $300 cash bond on this case with previously ordered conditions.  Court will not amend the bond at this time.  Previously ordered bond on this case will remain as is.

Defendant called.  He has the money to post his bond.  He stated that he will be in today to pay.

Defendant called, concerned that he was released this morning without posting the $200.00 cash bond.  Judge Becker says he needs to to post the $200.00 now.  I left the defendant a message on the phone number he gave me to post with us before 4:30 today, or if later, he will need to post at the Sheriff's Dept.  I also left a voice message with Capt. Bowe with the same information.  Defendant called back and he said he has the money and just needs to find a ride.
